Resources

The following is a list of resources that may be helpful for math students. To stay informed about opportunities around the math department, join our mailing list and ask the department advisors to add you to their mailing list.

  • Women in Mathematics (WiM)
  • Berkeley Mathematics Directed Reading Program:
    The Directed Reading Program provides undergraduates with the opportunity to work closely with UC Berkeley mathematics graduate students in an independent reading project.
  • The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Math Department:
    A student blog about life as an undergraduate math student at UC Berkeley, written by math peer advisors.
  • Putnam Exam Archive

Math Conferences:

  • Northern California Undergraduate Mathematics Conference
  • Joint Mathematics Meeting

Math Department Resources:

  • Math Department Calendar
  • Math Seminars
  • Distinguished Lecture Series
  • The Serge Lang Undergraduate Lectures
  • Many Cheerful Facts (defunct)

Undergraduate Advising:

  • Math Advsiors
  • Faculty Advisors
  • Peer Advisors

Other Student Groups:

  • Women in Mathematics (WiM)
  • Society of Physics Students at Berkeley (SPS)
  • Computer Science Undergraduate Association (CSUA)
  • Unbounded Representation (URep)
  • Noetherian Ring (NRing)
  • Mathematics Graduate Student Association (MGSA)

Math Community Nearby:

  • Mathematical Sciences Research Institute
  • Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing
  • Mathematics Group at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory

Practice Exams for Courses:

  • Department's Archive
  • Tau Beta Pi's Archive

LaTeX Tutorials:

  • Art of Problem Solving
  • LaTeX: Mathematics
  • Harvard Math Department's TeX Intro
  • Guide to Commutative Diagram Packages

Et cetera:

  • DeCal homepage
  • CalTeach

If youâ€™d like to stay in touch with our undergraduate math community even after graduating, please send an email to musa.berkeley@gmail.com and we will keep you informed of opportunities to contribute in the future. You can contribute by giving Math Monday talks or sharing your experience in professional or academic panels. We promise not to spam you!

MUSA is a Registered Student Organization acting independently of the University of California.
We take full responsibility for our organization and this web site.
Report problems with the site to the current webmaster.
